title: Just noticed All Assassins have 1 (no more no less) skillshots
body:
{{champion:55}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:555}}  only exeptions
All of the other assassins have 1 and only 1 skillshot
Ahri is kind of a mage assassin hybrid, so take it as you'd like
Just a fun fact

EDIT:  Added akali and pyke, new ones i kinda dont remember so well

replies.body: whats talon's skill shot?

> [{quoted}](name=MrFawknSunshine,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-09-15T23:00:16.430+0000)
>
> whats talon's skill shot?

w

> [{quoted}](name=DimPack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-09-15T23:00:38.891+0000)
>
> w

W isnt a skill shot. its aoe and it goes out in a cone, its like saying mord has a skill shot
It is a skillshot, just not a true linear one.  For example, Vel’Koz’s E is also a skillshot.

its a skillshot for kintergarden bois

Morde is debatable because it doesnt have travel time

> [{quoted}](name=RaikoPlays,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=0000000000000001,timestamp=2018-09-15T23:06:16.365+0000)
>
> its a skillshot for kintergarden bois
> 
> Morde is debatable because it doesnt have travel time

to me , talons W is as much of a skill shot as his R 

just saying
{{champion:245}} Q + W
Is W a skillshot? I wouldnt count it as one

What do you count as a skill shot then?

Are you only counting line skill shots? If so, that's fairly disingenuous

> [{quoted}](name=AvantelWings,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2018-09-15T23:15:22.110+0000)
>
> What do you count as a skill shot then?
> 
> Are you only counting line skill shots? If so, that's fairly disingenuous

I don't know why shaco counter as champion with skillshot even lol, he just throw box or clone.
So i don't know if the post is right about skillshots xD
He's on the other end with Katarina, where he has no skill shots. All their damage is either direct AoE where they're standing or point and click (or a box that shoots you)

Yeah, i added those 2 on my exeption list above
I just didnt think about ekko's W because doesnt come from the champion in a line to far from the champion, thats how most of skillshots work atleast. Of course there are always grey areas

> [{quoted}](name=RaikoPlays,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-15T23:33:56.312+0000)
>
> Yeah, i added those 2 on my exeption list above
> I just didnt think about ekko's W because doesnt come from the champion in a line to far from the champion, thats how most of skillshots work atleast. Of course there are always grey areas

That's not really the Leagues community of skillshots. That's just a ranged linear skillshot. Very specific.. Fizz's e is technically skillshot if you count ground targets and the first cast is a directional dash. If you count yasuo as an assasin, his q and his w are both "skillshots". 
Kassidin again if you count ground/directional target spells. Kayn has multiples.

> [{quoted}](name=AvantelWings,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-15T23:24:01.225+0000)
>
> He's on the other end with Katarina, where he has no skill shots. All their damage is either direct AoE where they're standing or point and click (or a box that shoots you)

Yah that is my point that not skillshot that is aoe.
{{champion:62}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:141}} etc all got that type of skill which consider an aoe over skillshot.

> [{quoted}](name=AvantelWings,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2018-09-15T23:15:22.110+0000)
>
> What do you count as a skill shot then?
> 
> Are you only counting line skill shots? If so, that's fairly disingenuous

Those are the ones most likely to miss. When your ability is AoE and covers such a wide area that it is next to impossible to miss you might as well categorize it as point and click with the potential to hit multiple targets. I believe it´s more helpful to look at AoE, travel time, range and delays than if it´s possible to miss or not. And assassins usually have either big AoEs (talon) or super quick travel times (leblanc)

i count a skillshot as a projectile with travel speed that you aim, so any aimable spell yasuo can block pretty much, with a few exceptions, lux like r and what not, so i wouldnt count his w as one, do you refer to a veigar e as a skillshot?

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-09-15T23:09:47.941+0000)
>
> {{champion:245}} Q + W

since you usually Q after your E it´s really hard to miss it.
What about leblanc
Eternal Chains is her only skillshot
Her dash would qualify as a skill shot.
Her dash is a skill shit dude..
then all assassins dont have one skillshot. case closed.
akali has 3 skillshots. Oops.
dashes are not skillshot, im unsure how akali q has interactions with other projectile and mitigations as such so its either 1 or 2, def not 3

Her Q, R, and first part of E are literally skillshots.  Her R is Definitely a skillshot, even if it's a dash.  It temporarily turns Akali herself into the projectile, and it very much CAN miss the target.  That's a skillshot.
i might give akali benefit of the doub here as it is fast and people worry about dodging it, but i wont be counting most dashes as skillshots

I agree that some aren't.  Ezreal E for example is sort of technically kind of maybe a little bit a skillshot, but I wouldn't consider it one - for example.  But Akali R, Malph R, really anything that can reliably "Miss" by just not aiming it properly.  Ahri R wouldn't be, as it's just a dash with auto targetted damage for example.  But WW's R is as much a Dash as Akali's R is, and there's no denying that it's a skillshot.

yeah true, but they are still dashes, even if you miss them you have dashed, and you arent aiming a projectile, you're moving yourself to harm the opponent, while you can still miss important aspects of dashes, or not hit the enemy, i would still not consider them skillshots, once a skillshot is thrown, if you miss you should get nothing of it (excluding maybe klepto effects that require u casting a spell), you dont aim skillshots away from your opponent but u can dash away, i would like to give you the challenge to tell me of a skillshot where after you cast it (and all effects requiring casting a spell like sheen) have resolved, you still get something even if it misses

Zoe E, leaves behind the AOE sleep field.  Karma Q(Empowered) leaves behind a field that can still cause damage.  I agree that in general missing a skillshot leaves you with no profit.  But at the same time, you can't say that a Malph R or Akali R is a Dash in the same aspect as a Lucian E, because his E doesn't do anything different whether it hits someone or not.  Or that any of them are the same as a Diana R, which is targetted.  They're all dashes, but some of them are also skillshots.    Interesting thing to think about, either way.
ok fuck good eye out on karma and zoe with their zoning

I think of them as a Skillshot, where your character IS the projectile that you fire(One that can go through Yasuo's wall, too!), rather than as just a dash - Lucian's E is just a dash, or Riven's shield dash is just a dash.  Malph R is a dash, but is totally a skillshot as well, there's no denying that he's one big projectile when he presses R - Just depends on how you intend to use it.
ok, lets have 2 different categories now, skillshots and aimable dashes, because otherwise this is just a circle of us 2 making the exact same 2 points

.....

I'm a Diana main.

Diana loves the moon.

The moon is circle.  

Thereby, you're spouting blasphemous nonsense.  ALL HAIL THE CIRCLE!

:) Lol.  But yes, I agree.  Two different sorts for sure.

> [{quoted}](name=FatedSaviour,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2018-09-16T08:53:27.285+0000)
>
> dashes are not skillshot, im unsure how akali q has interactions with other projectile and mitigations as such so its either 1 or 2, def not 3

Akali Q has instant travel time. Is it missable? Fuck yea it is. Does it have a slowing part and a non-slowing part implying skillful use? fuck yea it does. Stop arguing with logic. Its stupid to say that apples fall upwards even though one just fell on your head
read the other thread, the only reason this isnt making sense to you is because you dont want it to, bye forever

> [{quoted}](name=FatedSaviour,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2018-09-16T08:53:27.285+0000)
>
> dashes are not skillshot, im unsure how akali q has interactions with other projectile and mitigations as such so its either 1 or 2, def not 3

its either you are literally stupid. Or trolling me.

the definition of skillshot isnt aimable ability, i pulled this from and old archive
A Skillshot is a type of champion http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Ability that casts a projectile that requires careful aim to hit a target. Skillshots projectiles usually travel on a straight path for a limited distance, and usually hit only the first target they collide with. However there also exist skillshots that have global range and that can hit more than one target. Some champions use skillshots as their primary abilities. To land a skillshot it is important to consider the speed of the projectile (which is ability-specific) and the enemy movement. Delayed http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/AoE skills or missiles with instant travel time are not considered skillshots.

i do not consider dashes to be in this category, even if its a pyke e, i also wont count "cage spells" such as ekko w or veigar e, if you wanna discuss the definitions further i would be happy to, its an interesting topic
Does {{champion:555}} count? He's technically an assassin and his Q and E are both skillshots.
His ult could possibly qualify as well.

i think this post should be about making a clear definition for a skillshot, i dont refer to any dash spells as a skillshot, do you ever see a trist jump away and say that skillshot, do you ever refer to pyke e as a skillshot, leblanc w isnt really a skillshot, you refer to those as dashes, if you can think of any other debatable "skillshots" i would be happy to have a discussion over it, but dashes arent skillshots (other than cait e graves r etc)
I consider dashes skillshots, mainly due to Akali tbh. With her ult it's 2 dashes, and if she doesn't land them she doesn't get her stun or execute.

we went over this somewhere else on the thread, i know i, this other dude, and anyone else who agrees with me, are just gonna start calling dashes that can hurt or have impact aimable dashes, but not skillshots
Pyke's dash is debatable then. While running away with it may not be a skillshot, it may be when engaging since it can stun.
ive gone over this topic elsewhere somewhere on this thread, to put it short, u can gain something even if u dont hit anything with pyke e and its a dash so im not counting it as a skillshot
Yi has 0 skillshots. Akali can be considered to have 2 since Q is one and the toss on E (shuriken before the dash back) is one as well.

> [{quoted}](name=Alyndaria,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=A98pTsoE,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-09-15T23:10:05.606+0000)

well i guess he is an assassin like mundo is a tank. 

if a right click champ is an assassin who is purely stat check champ i guess {{champion:23}} would be an assassin too. 

i guess the consider his alpha strike making him untargetable/invisible the "assassin" part of his kit. 
but for the most part i see no difference between {{champion:11}} and {{champion:23}}
{{champion:238}} W is a skillshot too!
Ekko technically has 3? Q Timewinder, W AOE Stun skill Shot (I guess), R AOE Damage.
